channel.title: Forum suggestion #4
channel.description:
Okay well I have noticed that topics get "grave digged" and/or "bumped" all the time even though they are so many years old. I suggest that after a three month period the topic gets "auto locked" and an auto message is placed into the thread stating why and stating that if you need help with this topic or wish for this to be unlocked just ask a member of staff." why am I suggesting this? well quite frankly I just got "watched" for telling a ...poster...lets just call him that... bumping a dead, useless, two year old topic that will never have any true meaning. Am I mad? nah just a suggestion so others don't get "watched" for something that should had never occurred in the first place. To sum up my thoughts I leave you with this thought:
While we are free to choose our actions, we are not free to choose the consequences of our actions. Stephen R. Covey
So what am I saying? There would be no consequences of telling somebody the truth if a bumped/gravedigged topic never got reactivated by ..."posters" ... inb4anotherwarningforsuggesting?

item.title: Forum suggestion #4
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:32, topic:428441”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=531135.msg3881958#msg3881958 date=1326091831]
Already been summed up nicely, but gravedigging is not against the rules, except in cases where the topic would normally warrant a lock even if it wasn’t old. There are a few special cases that may require/suggest an old topic to be locked, but it really shouldn’t happen often

If a gravedig reply is spam, it can just be deleted, and the thread will move back to where it was.
[/quote]I agree and disagree actually.

Well mostly at the last comment.

A bumped thread with a USELESS post makes a topic that (generally) is old and out dated in the sense of quality of the work or whatever it is specifically be pointless and it just causes people to go and say stuff like " look at the date next time" etc…causing it to stay posted. If staff are too lazy to go and lock topics when a topic is reported as being bumped and was being old with irrelevant posts then there is an issue.[/quote]

You must have misunderstood david. He means that when the bumped posts are deleted, the topic will go back into the depths of the board, so people won’t continue posting on it.

We can’t help if someone posts something legitimate in a topic that’s 2 years old, and a bunch of forum members start flaming them for “gravedigging.” All we can do is post an explain it’s legitimate.

As for all this locking you’re suggesting, I’m simply not understanding it. Locking is used as a last resort, only. It’s either used as a mechanism to stop posting in a topic that does not need replies, or to stop continual off-topic discussion in a topic that’s not worth keeping open. Neither of these apply to the majority of gravedug threads. Why should they be locked if they can just be pushed back to where they came from if they were illegitimately bumped?
